tldr: Affected versions of the package are vulnerable to a denial-of-service condition due to a memory leak in Node.jsâ€™s OpenSSL integration. When converting X.509 certificate fields to UTF-8, allocated buffers are not freed, causing each call to `socket.getPeerCertificate(true)` to leak memory. A remote client can exploit this by repeatedly establishing TLS connections, leading to unbounded memory growth and eventual resource exhaustion.
doest_this_affect_me: You are affected if you are using a version that falls within the vulnerable range.
how_to_fix: Upgrade the `node` library to a patch version.
